body_html: @Pepslee Many thanks for your code. If you are using None as the batch_size in the placeholder, batch_range = tf.reshape(tf.range(output_shape[0], dtype=tf.int64), shape=[input_shape[0], 1, 1, 1]) fails with an error in reshape. Is there anyway around this?
body_text: @Pepslee Many thanks for your code. If you are using None as the batch_size in the placeholder,  batch_range = tf.reshape(tf.range(output_shape[0], dtype=tf.int64), shape=[input_shape[0], 1, 1, 1]) fails with an error in reshape. Is there anyway around this?
body: @Pepslee Many thanks for your code. If you are using None as the batch_size in the placeholder,  batch_range = tf.reshape(tf.range(output_shape[0], dtype=tf.int64), shape=[input_shape[0], 1, 1, 1]) fails with an error in reshape. Is there anyway around this?
